item.title: The struggle of being the last card.
item.author: sample@gmail.com (Lyka Sebelina)
item.description:
-Written By Sol

People always say that the youngest are the spoiled one but no one talks about the burden of being the youngest.

How unfair life is sometimes…

item.title: Leron: A Melody of Longing and Hope
item.author: sample@gmail.com (Lyka Sebelina)
item.description:
-Written By Tine Lim

Pagmamahal oras at haplos

Ng ‘yong kamay ang aking hanap

Ika’y nagkulang at ngayo’y nangungulila

Listening to “Leron” for the first time felt like hearing a song I didn’t know I needed but somehow always carried in my heart.

item.title: Suicide is About Wanting to Live
item.author: sample@gmail.com (Lyka Sebelina)
item.description:
-Written By Odawni

The Paradox of Suicidal Thinking

If you’ve never experienced suicidal thinking, the idea of wanting to end your life seems extreme. It is.

It’s extremely painful to wrestle with a brain screaming at you that you’re better off dead.

item.title: this house never feels like “home”
item.author: sample@gmail.com (Lyka Sebelina)
item.description:
-Written By Sol

Where do you go when your home does not feels like home…?

They say the word “house” is different to the word “home” wherein the word house is about a building made for people or a family to live in, while the word home is about the family living in a house, a special place where you feel most comfortable and that belongs to you, or a place that full of love and caring family.

item.title: You Are Not Everyone’s Cup of Tea, and That’s Okay
item.author: sample@gmail.com (Lyka Sebelina)
item.description:
-Written By LifeInLetters

There’s a unique kind of freedom in realizing that you don’t have to be loved or understood by everyone. In a world that constantly pushes us to fit in, to be liked, and to meet expectations, it’s easy to feel like something is wrong with us when we don’t. But here’s the truth: you were not made to be everyone’s favorite, and you don’t have to be.

item.title: the pain of a student leader
item.author: sample@gmail.com (Lyka Sebelina)
item.description:
-Written By Spamlydumbest

So many eyes are waiting for me to fail.

Student leaders, like all of us, are humans. Many people forget that.

We may have chosen to serve the students and the school, but it feels like being under their microscope means that a single wrong move might portray us as the bad guy.

item.title: the uncertainty of everything
item.author: sample@gmail.com (Lyka Sebelina)
item.description:
-Written By Apollyon

Has the uncertainty of the world ever crossed your mind? What will happen in the future? I often ponder what the future holds and I always believe in the saying “It is what it is.”

item.title: Ang paglubog ng bangka sa gitna ng malakas na alon
item.author: sample@gmail.com (Lyka Sebelina)
item.description:
-Written By Maria Coquilla

Sa gitna ng malakas na
pagpatak ng sanlibong
butil ng ulan at malamig
na simoy na hangin,
ako’y nasa kanto ng terando
at tila’y nagmumukmok sa
bawat kurbada’t hanging dumadaan
Tila’y mga lusaw na
halaya’t dikyang dumadampi
sa aking tuyo’t tigang na
lalamunan, inuming kolang
sinawsawan ng kinukubong yelo

item.title: the comfort in “wait nalang kita”
item.author: sample@gmail.com (Lyka Sebelina)
item.description:
-Written By Kalon

There’s something soft and gentle about “hintayin/wait nalang kita” no? When you think about it, simple lang ‘to pero it shows na someone is waiting for you patiently. Na para bang “Gawin mo lang yung mga dapat mong gawin, nandito lang ako, hinihintay ka.” or “You do your thing, I’ll wait.”

item.title: Inspiration
item.author: sample@gmail.com (Lyka Sebelina)
item.description:
• the comfort in “wait nalang kita”

There’s something soft and gentle about “hintayin/wait nalang kita” no? When you think about it, simple lang ‘to pero it shows na someone is waiting for you patiently…

There’s a unique kind of freedom in realizing that you don’t have to be loved or understood by everyone. In a world that constantly pushes us to…

People always say that the youngest are the spoiled one but no one talks about the burden of being the youngest…

  • the pain of a student leader

Student leaders, like all of us, are humans. Many people forget that. We may have chosen to serve the students and the school, but it feels like being under their microscope means…

item.title: Thoughts
item.author: sample@gmail.com (Lyka Sebelina)
item.description:
• the uncertainty of everything

Has the uncertainty of the world ever crossed your mind? What will happen in the future? I often ponder what the future holds and I always believe in the saying “It is what it is.”…

item.title: A Little Bit of Magic
item.author: sample@gmail.com (Lyka Sebelina)
item.description: I believe in magic, not in the mystical sense, but in the small, everyday wonders — like a smile from a stranger or a piece of art that resonates with your soul. That’s where the magic lives.

item.title: Embracing Imperfection
item.author: sample@gmail.com (Lyka Sebelina)
item.description: In a world obsessed with perfection, I’ve learned that imperfection is where the beauty lies. It’s the cracks in the surface that allow us to grow, learn, and connect.

item.title: Finding Inspiration in Everyday Life
item.author: sample@gmail.com (Lyka Sebelina)
item.description: I often find inspiration in the most unexpected places: the rustling of leaves, the smell of fresh coffee, or a simple conversation with a stranger. Creativity is everywhere, if we just stop to notice it.

item.title: Nature’s Lessons
item.author: sample@gmail.com (Lyka Sebelina)
item.description: Nature has a way of teaching us without words. The way trees bend with the wind, the seasons shift without resistance, and the sun rises no matter what — we could all learn a little something from the natural world.

item.title: On Letting Go
item.author: sample@gmail.com (Lyka Sebelina)
item.description: Letting go isn’t about forgetting; it’s about making space for something new. We hold onto so many things that weigh us down — it’s freeing to release them, even when it feels hard.

item.title: Reflections on Time
item.author: sample@gmail.com (Lyka Sebelina)
item.description: Time seems to slip away faster the older I get. I’ve learned that the key to truly appreciating time is not to rush through it, but to savor each moment, no matter how ordinary it seems.

item.title: Seeking Balance
item.author: sample@gmail.com (Lyka Sebelina)
item.description: Balance is something I’m always striving for. It’s not about perfection, but about finding harmony between work, rest, relationships, and personal growth. It’s a daily practice, and sometimes, that’s enough.

item.title: The Art of Saying No
item.author: sample@gmail.com (Lyka Sebelina)
item.description: Saying “no” can be one of the most powerful acts of self-care. It’s not about rejecting others; it’s about protecting your own space, time, and energy. Setting boundaries is an act of kindness to yourself.

item.title: The Importance of Silence
item.author: sample@gmail.com (Lyka Sebelina)
item.description: Silence has its own language. In the quiet, we hear our thoughts more clearly, find clarity, and discover truths that are often drowned out by noise.

item.title: The Power of a Good Story
item.author: sample@gmail.com (Lyka Sebelina)
item.description: A well-told story has the power to change the way we see the world. Whether it’s a book, a poem, or a personal experience, stories shape our reality in ways we often don’t realize.

item.title: The Quiet Moments
item.author: sample@gmail.com (Lyka Sebelina)
item.description: Sometimes, the smallest moments hold the greatest meaning — like the quiet before dawn or the silence between words. These moments remind me that stillness can be just as powerful as action.

item.title: Writing as Therapy
item.author: sample@gmail.com (Lyka Sebelina)
item.description: Sometimes, the act of writing is the most powerful way to process emotions. When life feels overwhelming, writing it down can bring clarity and healing, one word at a time.

item.title: I Hope My Younger Self Forgives Me For What We Have Not Become
item.author: sample@gmail.com (Lyka Sebelina)
item.description:
-Written By Che

Younger me has so many dreams she wanted to achieve. I can clearly remember how her eyes shine when daydreaming.

I am sorry for many things I did not achieve for her because I fell short. Maybe I was a coward for not pursuing a course or a profession both of us wanted, but know that I choose practicality above all else.

item.title: doll shoes
item.author: sample@gmail.com (Lyka Sebelina)
item.description:
-Written By Snowpy

I’m learning to love the sound of my feet walking away from the things that aren’t meant for me.

Just last August, I got my first heartbreak — no, not from a boy whom I met while I sacrificed my whole summer in review school, but with a school which I thought would open its gate to let me in while I carry a bag full of my family’s hopes and dreams for me.

item.title: My most quiet moments are the loudest ones.
item.author: sample@gmail.com (Lyka Sebelina)
item.description:
-Written By EriWrites

Sometimes, I wish death scares me more than living does. For I always wonder:

“Am I living, or just passing time?”

“Am I gentle, or the world is just too cruel?”

item.title: Who am I ?!
item.author: sample@gmail.com (Lyka Sebelina)
item.description:
-Written By Bino

Who am I ?! This is the most asked question in my life. Yet no clear answer has yet been found.

As a child, the answer to this question was simple. Say my name to the question of who. Aha ..! Simple and beautiful. In that answer, parents and siblings in adolescence. I thought to myself that the answer was too clear.
